content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar has entered into a strategic partnership agreement with Quorumad S.A. to cooperate on projects in the energy sector in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru. 

The agreement covers resource cooperation on loss adjusting projects within the energy industry, including the hydrocarbon (upstream, midstream and downstream) and petrochemical sectors, along with power and renewables. Loss adjusting is the investigation and resolution of insurance claims, including commercial disputes.

Under the agreement, Quorumad will provide in-country competence and manpower in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru to work jointly with AqualisBraemar’s experts. 

“This collaboration agreement will allow us to enhance the quality of our broad spectrum of services provided in the Latin American region. It will strengthen our presence locally and the service level we provide to our clients, taking advantage of the synergies created by the quality and experience of both AqualisBraemar and Quorumad,” says Dr. Bader Diab, AqualisBraemar’s managing director of the Americas region. 

In South America, AqualisBraemar has offices in Brazil, Chile and Mexico. The company offers adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries, through its strategically-located global network of offices. It is part of Oslo-listed consultancy group AqualisBraemar ASA.

Quorumad is a loss adjusting company that originates from Ecuador and delivers its services across Latin America.

For further information, please contact:

Investors and financial media

Kim Boman, CFO, AqualisBraemar ASA
Telephone: +47 959 63 912

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About AqualisBraemar ASA

AqualisBraemar ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public listed company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers adjusting, marine, offshore and renewables consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 48 offices located across 5 continents in 33 countries. AqualisBraemar ASA operates under three distinct brands globally:

  • AqualisBraemar: a leading adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy to the energy, shipping and insurance industries
  • AqualisBraemar Yacht Services: a specialised marine consultant to the superyacht market
  • Offshore Wind Consultants: an independent consultancy to the offshore renewables sector

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar enters Chinese offshore aquaculture partnership
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar and “East China Sea Fisheries Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Fishery Sciences (ECSFRI-CAFS)” have entered into an agreement regarding the research and development of offshore aquaculture concepts and solutions.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to acquire LOC Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has entered into an agreement to acquire 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar and HOSE International enter inspection partnership
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar and HOSE International have signed a memorandum of understanding to jointly provide rig and well control inspection services for the offshore industry.

jetpack-related-posts.title: McDermott signs up AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has entered into a master services agreement with McDermott Asia Pacific Sdn Bhd (McDermott) to provide engineering reviews and marine warranty services for the company’s offshore operations in the Asia Pacific region.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar beefs up ports & harbours offering to tackle renewables rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to ramp up its ports and harbours unit and combine resources and know-how with its offshore wind consultancy unit OWC, following a surge in assignments driven by renewable energy developments.
